title: Accessible Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A creamy, delicious pasta dish with accessibility alternatives for every step

alternatives.name: Short pasta (penne, rigatoni)
alternatives.reason: Easier to eat for those with motor difficulties
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: No twirling required, easier to scoop

alternatives.name: Pre-diced pancetta
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Eliminates knife work for those with limited mobility

alternatives.name: Vegetarian bacon bits
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: No chopping, no raw meat handling

alternatives.name: Pasteurized liquid eggs
alternatives.reason: No cracking required, safer for immunocompromised
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: No shell fragments risk, easier to measure

alternatives.name: Pre-grated Parmesan
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Eliminates repetitive hand motion and sharp grater use

alternatives.name: Electric kettle + large bowl
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Reduces risk for those with seizure disorders or mobility issues

alternatives.name: Microwave-safe dish
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Safer for those uncomfortable with open flames or hot surfaces

alternatives.name: Kitchen scissors
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Better grip and control for those with limited hand dexterity

steps.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions until al dente.

alternatives.instruction: Boil water in electric kettle. Place spaghetti in large bowl, pour over boiling water, cover tightly and let sit for 15-18 minutes until tender.
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Safer for those with seizure disorders or fear of open flames

tips: Add salt to water for better flavor

steps.instruction: While pasta cooks, dice the bacon into small pieces and cook in a large frying pan over medium heat until crispy, about 5-6 minutes.

alternatives.instruction: Place pre-diced pancetta in microwave-safe dish and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes until crispy, stirring halfway through.
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Eliminates knife work and hot grease splatter risk

steps.instruction: In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese. Season with black pepper.

alternatives.instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine liquid eggs and pre-grated Parmesan cheese with a fork. Season with black pepper.
alternatives.reason: No egg cracking or cheese grating required
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Eliminates fine motor skills needed for cracking eggs and grating cheese

steps.instruction: Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain pasta. Immediately add hot pasta to the pan with bacon.

alternatives.instruction: Carefully pour off most water from pasta bowl, leaving about 1 cup. Use a large spoon to transfer pasta to serving bowl with bacon.
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Reduces risk of burns and strain for those with limited strength

steps.instruction: Remove pan from heat. Quickly pour egg mixture over hot pasta, tossing continuously with tongs to create a creamy sauce. Add pasta water as needed.
safetyWarnings: Work quickly to prevent eggs from scrambling

alternatives.instruction: Let pasta cool for 1 minute. Slowly drizzle egg mixture while stirring gently with a large spoon. The residual heat will cook the eggs safely.
alternatives.accessibilityBenefit: Less coordination required, safer technique for beginners

tips: The key is to work off heat
If sauce is too thick, add more pasta water
